Development of Sales te Candidate No.:		59305
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Central Southern
QUALIFICATIONS
B.Eng. (Hons) Chemical Engineering
Professional
Chartered Engineer
Member of the Institution of Chemical Engineers
CAREER SUMMARY
Mar 2021 to date EnerMech – Aberdeen
Position: Head of Sales and Business Development
2019 – Nov 2020 KBR
Position: Director of Business Development – Upstream and Downstream Sectors
Focused on Upstream (onshore & offshore) and Downstream projects for clients in Europe and the Middle East.
Secured projects including in Saudi Arabia and Oman.
Worked with the BU Leadership to get the Leatherhead office recognised and able to deliver downstream projects.
Identified and lead multiple bids for clients (small and major) in both brownfield and greenfield projects.
Development of Sales team with Strategy, positioning, client relationships and pursuit training and implementation.
2006 – 2018 Jacobs Engineering, UK
2011 – 2018
Position: Executive Director Business Development – EMEA
He was a member of the newly formed Global Strategic Sales team to focus on game changing projects for Europe, Africa and Middle East.
This included strategic partnering with other service providers, technology licensors and other contractors. His primary focus was on key international projects with complex execution, collaboration, contracting and / or risks.
Developed the Upstream Strategy to expand Jacobs European base to Middle East and Africa.
Responsible for development of key relationships with technology and construction companies.
Strategic responsibility for relationships with both private and public sector clients. Fully responsible for short and long range plans, budgets and pursuits, targets and KPI’s. Achieved the five year targets in two and a half years going from zero to six and a half million manhours won.
He set up multiple successful partnerships with companies to ensure they were best placed in the market including with Penspen, Genesis, Xodus, Stork, POSCO
Key wins during this period included:
BP Khazzan Project Phase 1 (Jacobs largest ever process sector win and most profitable at the time) and subsequently Phase 2 for full EPCm for process scope and FEED and (deep) PMC of all Infrastructure scope,
Shell Bacton Rejuvenation Project EPC with self-perform construction, POSCO SNG Project FEED&PMC.
2008 – 2011
Position: Director Business Development – UK&I
Supporting offices in the UK and Ireland region.
Developed new relationships with Centrica (multiple projects), Shell (Multiple projects), Total (CTY Project), Wheelabrator (EfW project), POSCO (multiple projects), Talisman and multiple projects in the Middle East including Saudi Aramco, SABIC, JANA, Borouge, IDEA. Developed and implemented the UK Upstream Market Strategy.
Feb – Sept 2008
Position: Project Manager
INEOS Oligomers / Gemini Project, Belgium
Brownfield project to install a new plant to produce Vinyledene using a slip stream of the Oligomers plant.
Project won as a concept study and subsequently won and executed the FEED phase.
2006 – 2008
Position: Project Manager
INEOS Oligomers SuperFlex Project, Belgium
Brownfield project to install a new unit to increase the plant flexibility to produce a wider variety of Oligomers to suit global demand.
Scope began as concept study, won and executed the FEED and subsequently EPCm phases.
Originally had site based team and then ran detailed engineering in Manchester and Antwerp offices with Mumbai HVEC before moving back to site for construction.
2006 – 2008
Position: Operational Sales / Project Manager
Field Services
Seconded into Business Development group to “shake the tree” in the hydrocarbon business sector. Identified and won the Total Qatar DME Project, Simon Storage Tankage Design Project, EoN IGGC Project, INEOS Oligomers Superflex and Gemini Projects (became project manager for these in addition to Ops Sales) and Covanta Dublin WtE Project.
Identified and developed the Alliance at ConocoPhillips at the Humber Refinery (alliance won and on-going).
In addition, responsible for developing newly formed engineering division in Immingham, Sales and Marketing.
Mar – Sept 2006
Position: Project Engineering Manager / Oper

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
